ibis.ipl
Interface Location

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<Location>, Iterable<String>, Serializable
public interface Location
extends Serializable, Comparable<Location>, Iterable<String>

Represents a location on which an Ibis instance runs. This is the data type returned by IbisIdentifier.location(). It represents a number of levels, for instance hostname, domain, in that order, t.i., from detailed to coarse. Level 0 represents the most detailed, level numberOfLevels()-1 the most coarse.

Locations should be comparable with equals(), so implementations probably redefine hashCode() and equals().

Note that this interface extends Comparable and Iterable. So, locations can be sorted, and the user can iterate over the levels in a location.

Method Detail

numberOfLevels

int numberOfLevels()
Returns the number of levels in this location.

Returns:
the number of levels.

getLevel

String getLevel(int levelIndex)
Returns the name of the specified level. Levels are numbered from 0 to numberOfLevels()-1.

Parameters:
levelIndex - the specified level.
Returns:
the corresponding name.
Throws:
ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - is thrown when the specified level does not correspond to a level in this location.

getLevels

String[] getLevels()
Returns the location as a String array.

Returns:
the location as a string array.

numberOfMatchingLevels

int numberOfMatchingLevels(Location location)
Returns the number of matching levels with the specified location, comparing from coarse to detailed.

Parameters:
location - the location to match with.
Returns:
the number of matching levels.

getParent

Location getParent()
Returns the parent location of this location. This is a location object that has the most detailed level stripped of. If the object has only one level (or less), a location with 0 levels is returned.

Returns:
the parent location.
